intro: Hieracium maranzae subsp. izzense, commonly known as the Izzent's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. It has serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
